questions.question: If you had 1 million euros, what would you do with it?

answers.answer: I'm only fifty-two years old but I sometimes think about the old age. When I see old people who can't stay any more alone at home, I'm sad. I know some of them in my circle. Their children are obliged to put them in an old people's home. They would prefer to stay with their family and friends.

If I won one million euros, here's what I would do: I would buy a piece of land and I would build a comfortable house with some flats. Every flat would contain a bedroom, a bathroom and a sitting room.

In this building, there would be also rooms for the community life as a kitchen, a living-room, a sitting-room with a television, a terrace and a garden. Many people like a cook, a nurse, a gardener and others would be in charge of the elderly people and would live among them with their family.
So these people would never be alone and would live happy.
One day, when I'll be old, I would seize the opportunity to live like them in my house of happiness.
